explanations.A: An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. Which of the remaining words could contain numbers, letters AND an addition symbol?
explanations.B: A term is a single component. e.g. 3p is a term and 7 is a term. This contains an addition symbol as well, which of the choices could that lead you to?
explanations.C: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'p' is the variable. This contains an addition symbol as well, which of the choices could that lead you to?
explanations.D: This is an expression. It contains one or more terms and does not contain an equals '=' sign.

explanations.A: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'g' is the variable. This contains a subtraction symbol as well, which of the choices could that lead you to?
explanations.B: This is an expression. It contains one or more terms and does not contain an equals '=' sign.
explanations.C: An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. Which of the remaining words could contain numbers, letters AND a subtraction symbol?
explanations.D: A term is a single component. e.g. 6 is a term and 3g is a term. This contains a subtraction symbol as well, which of the choices could that lead you to?

explanations.A: Not quite. An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. This is a single letter.
explanations.B: 3p is a term but we need the most appropriate word for p on its own.
explanations.C: p is a variable. It represents an unknown value.
explanations.D: 3p + 7 is an expression but we need the most appropriate word for p on its own.

explanations.A: g is a variable. It represents an unknown value.
explanations.B: 6 - 3g is an expression but we need the most appropriate word for g on its own.
explanations.C: Not quite. An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. This is a single letter.
explanations.D: 3g is a term but we need the most appropriate word for g on its own.

explanations.A: This is an equation because it contains an equals '=' sign.
explanations.B: A term is a single component. e.g. 3p is a term, 7 is a term and 10 is a term. This contains an equals '=' symbol too. Which of the remaining words could that apply to?
explanations.C: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'p' is the variable. This contains an equals '=' symbol too. Which of the remaining words could that apply to?
explanations.D: Expressions do not contain equals '=' signs. Which of the remaining words contain an equals '=' symbol?

explanations.A: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'g' is the variable. This contains an equals '=' symbol too. Which of the remaining words could that apply to?
explanations.B: Expressions do not contain equals '=' signs. Which of the remaining words contain an equals '=' symbol?
explanations.C: This is an equation because it contains an equals '=' sign.
explanations.D: A term is a single component. e.g. 6 is a term, 3g is a term and 3 is a term. This contains an equals '=' symbol too. Which of the remaining words could that apply to?

explanations.A: We could call this an equation, because it contains an equals sign, but there is a more appropriate word to use.
explanations.B: This is a formula because it gives us a mathematical rule to calculate the volume of a cone. By substituting values for the radius (r) and the height (h) we can work out the volume (V).
explanations.C: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'h' and 'r' are the variables. This also contains an equals symbol and has a mathematical use. Which word would that make most appropiate?
explanations.D: Expressions do not contain equals '=' signs. This contains an equals symbol and has a mathematical use. Which word would that make most appropiate?

explanations.A: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'r' is the variable. This also contains an equals symbol and has a mathematical use. Which word would that make most appropiate?
explanations.B: Expressions do not contain equals '=' signs. This contains an equals symbol and has a mathematical use. Which word would that make most appropiate?
explanations.C: We could call this an equation, because it contains an equals sign, but there is a more appropriate word to use.
explanations.D: This is a formula because it gives us a mathematical rule to calculate the volume of a sphere. By substituting in a value for the radius (r), we can work out the volume (V).

explanations.A: An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. Which of the remaining words could contain numbers, letters and multiplication?
explanations.B: This is a term. A term can be a letter, a number or a combination of letters and numbers multiplied or divided together.
explanations.C: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'p' on its own is the variable. Which word best describes a variable multiplied by a number?
explanations.D: 3p + 7 is an expression but we need the most appropriate word for 3p on its own, without the addition.

explanations.A: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown value. Here 'g' on its own is the variable. Which word best describes a variable multiplied by a number?
explanations.B: 6 - 3g is an expression but we need the most appropriate word for 3g on its own, without a subtraction taking place.
explanations.C: An equation always contains an equals '=' symbol. Which of the remaining words could contain numbers, letters and multiplication?
explanations.D: This is a term. A term can be a letter, a number or a combination of letters and numbers multiplied or divided together.
